intro: Pedicularis bomiensis, commonly known as the Bomi orchid, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of China. It belongs to the family Scrophulariaceae and is characterized by its vibrant, showy flowers that range in color from red to orange. The plant typically grows in alpine meadows and rocky habitats, thriving in cool, moist environments. Its flowers are often visited by pollinators such as bees and butterflies, contributing to its ecological role in its native habitat. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
